contentList.content: Chronurgy Magic

Focusing on the manipulation of time, those who follow the Chronurgy tradition learn to alter the pace of reality to their liking. Using the ramping of anticipatory dunamis energy, these mages can bend the flow of time as adroitly as a skilled musician plays an instrument, lending themselves and their allies an advantage in the blink of an eye.
Dunamancer

The esoteric powers developed and harnessed through the use of dunamis are still very much a rare and carefully guarded feature of the Kryn Dynasty in Wildemount. However, such arcana is hard to keep hidden, especially in times of war. Spies and defectors have long smuggled out the secrets of this obscure magical practice, and even now it slowly disseminates beyond Xhorhas.
Dunamancy spells are readily available to the Chonurgy and Graviturgy subclasses and should not be simply added to the full spell lists of other spellcasting classes.
Chronal Shift Charge
Momentary Stasis Charge
Arcane Abeyance Charge
You can use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ChronalShift">Chronal Shift</LSTag> twice.
You can use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MomentaryStasis">Momentary Stasis</LSTag> a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> modifier.
Once you create a mote with <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="ArcaneAbeyance">Arcane Abeyance</LSTag>, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
Chronal Shift
Chronal Shift: Bonus
Chronal Shift: Penalty

Exert limited control over the flow of time around a target. After you or a nearby creature makes an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> or a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, you can force the target to reroll. The target must use the result of the second roll. Additionally, you can grant a 1d4 bonus or penalty to a nearby creature's <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>.

Exert limited control over the flow of time around a target, giving it a 1d4 bonus or penalty to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>.
Exert limited control over the flow of time around a target, granting them a 1d4 bonus to their <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>.
Affected entity has a 1d4 bonus to their <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>.
Exert limited control over the flow of time around a target, imposing a 1d4 penalty to their <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>.
Affected entity has a 1d4 penalty to their <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>.

Exert limited control over the flow of time around a target, forcing them to reroll an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> or a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>. The target must use the result of the second roll.
Temporal Awareness
You may add Intelligence modifier to your initiative rolls.
This entity's Intelligence modifier has been added to their initiative rolls.
Momentary Stasis
<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MOMENTARY_STASIS">Encase</LSTag> a target in a field of magical energy until the end of your next turn, or until it takes damage.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> The creature must be Large or smaller.

Affected entity is encased in a field of magical energy until the end of the Wizard's next turn, or until it takes any damage.

While encased in this way, the creature is incapacitated and cannot move or take actions, bonus actions, or reactions.
Arcane Abeyance
Reach into a pocket of time where a spell has been cast and condense its essence into a tiny mote. This mote can be used by yourself or a party member to release the spell within.
Arcane Abeyance: Level 1 Spells
Reach into a pocket of time where a 1st level spell has been cast and condense its essence into a tiny mote. This mote can be used by yourself or a party member to release the spell within.
If not used before performing a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, the bead vanishes and the spell within is lost.

Sapping Sting
Sap the vitality of a creature, possibly causing it to fall <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Must be a Dunamancy Wizard to use this cantrip.
Gift of Alacrity
You or an ally is granted a +[1] bonus to their Initiative <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>.
+[1] added to Initiative <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>.
Magnify Gravity
Gravity in a [1] sphere centered on a chosen point increases momentarily, potentially halving the <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> of creatures in the area.
<LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> halved.
Fortune's Favor

Impart latent luck to yourself or an ally. When the chosen creature makes an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, it can choose to gain a +[1] bonus to the roll. Alternatively, when an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> is made against the chosen creature, it can choose to impose a -[1] penalty to the roll.

Creature can grant a bonus +[1] to an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag> of theirs or grant a -[1] penalty against an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against them.
When a chosen creature applies the bonus or penalty, the spell on that creature ends.
Fortune's Favor: Self
Grant a +[1] bonus to your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>.
Fortune's Favor: Enemy
Impose a -[1] penalty to an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> made against you.
Activate to grant yourself a +[1] bonus to your next <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>.
Pulse Wave
Unleash intense pressure in a cone that possibly pushes or pulls creatures and objects up to [1].
Targets still take half damage and aren't pulled or pushed.
Deals an additional [1] and increases distance pulled or pushed by [2] per level.
Pulse Wave: Push
Unleash intense pressure in a cone that possibly pushes creatures and objects up to [1].
Pulse Wave: Pull
Unleash intense pressure in a cone that possibly pulls creatures and objects up to [1].
Gravity Sinkhole
Targets still take half damage and aren't pulled.
Create a sphere of crushing force that possibly pulls all creatures within toward the center of the sphere.
Temporal Shunt
Prepare yourself to potentially send a creature to another point in time when they attempt to make an attack or cast a spell.
Send a creature to another point in time when they attempt to make an attack or cast a spell.
The creature reappears in the space it was previously on the start of its next turn.
Send a creature to another point in time when it casts a spell or makes an attack, causing the action to fail before it has any effect.
Send a creature and [1] other creature to another point in time when it casts a spell or makes an attack, causing the action to fail before it has any effect.
Vanished to another point in time.
Targets still take half damage and aren't slowed.
Wielder of Dunamis

The esoteric powers developed and harnessed through the use of dunamis are still very much a rare and carefully guarded feature of the Kryn Dynasty in the Wildemount region. However, such arcana is hard to keep hidden.

Your skills as a Dunamancy Wizard gives you access to a set of spells available only to Chronurgy and Graviturgy Wizards. These spells can be learned as normal when levelling up and unlocking the corresponding spell slot levels.
